definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: One day, Einstein was walking in a street in New Youk.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，爱因斯坦走在纽约的大街上。

sentences.english: Albert Einstein's parents feared he was sub-normal.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的父母当初曾经担心他发育不正常。

sentences.english: Degenhart also predicted that Einstein "would never get anywhere in life."
sentences.chinese: 狄根哈特还预言爱因斯坦“永远不会有出息”。

sentences.english: In the Einsteinian universe, time is not absolute.
sentences.chinese: 在爱因斯坦宇宙中，时间没有绝对值。

sentences.english: Blame Albert Einstein for rousting you out of bed.
sentences.chinese: 要怪就怪爱因斯坦把你从床上叫起来吧。

sentences.english: It was Einstein's thoughts on human rights and democracy that awakened me.
sentences.chinese: 是爱因斯坦的人权和民主思想唤醒了我。

sentences.english: Einstein was famous for his Theory of Relativ IT y.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦以他的相对论而出名。

sentences.english: But what do we care what Einstein says?
sentences.chinese: 但我们到底关心爱因斯坦说的什么呢？

sentences.english: In that sense, Einstein is still going strong.
sentences.chinese: 由此而言，爱因斯坦还是很有天赋的。

sentences.english: The Einsteins could not afford to pay for his advanced education.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦一家负担不起他的提前教育。

sentences.english: Einstein has performed immortal feats for bringing forward the time of terminating the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦为二战的结束时间提前，立下了不朽的功勋。

sentences.english: Einstein was one of the greatest intellects of his time.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦是他的时代里最有才智的人之一。

sentences.english: Einstein and Besso walk slowly down Speichergasse in the late afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，爱因斯坦和贝索顺斯帕雪街慢慢走着。

sentences.english: For perhaps the hundredth time, I try to think like Einstein.
sentences.chinese: 可能这是我第一百次，想要像爱因斯坦一样思考。

sentences.english: Waldow said. Einstein also enjoyed mushrooms with his eggs.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔多说，爱因斯坦还喜欢在鸡蛋里加蘑菇。

sentences.english: He appered different from others since he was little.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦从小就表现的与其他人不同。

definition: Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Hawkins or Hawking/Stephen Hawking (1942-2018), English theoretical physicist
Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
